intro: Xanthocephalum centauroides, commonly known as the goldenhead bush, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators. Xanthocephalum centauroides is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
